Topic.Title: N ew ebay fees ridiculous

Message.Msg: do the match fool. ebay has a calculator. In most cases items under $5 are 50% , under 10$ 25%, and under $20 30%. Add another 3% from paypal and on a $5 item you make less than a buck

Topic.Title: N ew ebay fees ridiculous

Message.Msg: Ebays calculator: Fixed price item $20 & $10 shipping with a basic store fees are $2.40 - .32 discount for TRS = $2.08 + paypal fees for a total of about 15%

Topic.Title: N ew ebay fees ridiculous

Message.Msg: I am short this at about 54.50, but I am an eBay user. It's hard to be "done" with eBay since the only real alternative I can think of are craigslist and local classifieds. Am I missing something? Fundamentally you are completely right about fees. Things started going haywire with the PayPal acquisition, which made a partnership outright incest.

Topic.Title: Amazing if Ebay pulls off 1 hour delivery

Message.Msg: You've obviously never sold on eBay (much like eBay executives who dream up this nonsense). eBay buyers are cheap, cheap, cheap and complain about normal shipping charges !! There's no way eBay bottom feeders are going to pay for one hour delivery. Think about it? A gallon of gas is $4, driver costs $7-$10 per hour. You're talking $10 per delivery in expenses alone. So I'd like to see the eBay shopper who is going to pay $15-$20 to get a $5 charger delivered in an hour?

Topic.Title: Congrats to China vendors on Ebay

Message.Msg: Read the proposed bill. Merchants/Sellers who have less than $1 million in out-of-state sales are exempt from collecting tax. On the other hand, most of the Chinese mega sellers use a US address to have their listings in eBay's US site. Despite the fact they ship from China, they will be required to pay US taxes due to having a US based business location. This is why eBay CEO is lobbying against the bill. This bill actually levels the playing field for small and mom&pop sellers.

Topic.Title: Congrats to China vendors on Ebay

Message.Msg: Did you notice Amazon supports the bill Amazon wants small Ebay sellers to SUFFER Jeff Bezos can kiss my BUT

Topic.Title: Amazing if Ebay pulls off 1 hour delivery

Message.Msg: Ebay tested it in what 5 cities and now are expanding it nationwide. I think $5 is too cheap, Ebay should charge $10 imo fo 1 hour service. Business customers don't care - the company pays for the item.

Topic.Title: Amazing if Ebay pulls off 1 hour delivery

Message.Msg: It was tested in San Francisco, San Jose and New York. Future plans include Dallas and Chicago. Get your facts straight. Delivery is by bicycle messenger. This may work in a big city but it's hardly going to float in the suburbs. In case you didn't figure out, what eBay gets is the transaction is paid for with Paypal. The goal being to increase the number of Paypal transactions even at a loss, so misinformed investors think Paypal is actually gaining ground.

Topic.Title: Fair Marketplace bill, not applied to ebay???

Message.Msg: eBay is on a slippery slope. I could see where the fact they are collecting fees and offering "buyer protection" scheme that would include eBay as a contributing party and not a third-party for each sale made on eBay. Of course, any sales tax would be passed onto sellers.

Topic.Title: Amazing if Ebay pulls off 1 hour delivery

Message.Msg: quinn, the 1 hr delivery I think is targeted for large stores like Best Buiy or Home Depot. that have ubiquious US national presence. Anyway, they will tweek it as needed. But a great start imo.

Message.Title: eBay is a Sinking Ship
Message.Msg: Online sales tax on the way, plus increase in fees from Mastercard on Paypal, Visa soon to follow. Heading into the slowest retail months and once again another fee increase. the 3rd increase in 4 years. Wonder why eBay had to raise fees again May 1st if they're doing so good as the CEO states over and over???? 200% increase on listing fees for Premium store owners. Huge increase on FVF's for high ticket items. Last year it was FVF's on shipping, before that it was the "stores into core" fiasco. In 2009, it was $15.95 for a store with .03 cent listings. In 2013, it's $59.95 for a Premium store with .10 cent listings. 300% fee increase !!! BEFORE THE FIRST SALE IS MADE !!!! Amazon, charges $0 listing or store fees. No wonder merchants have flocked to Amazon and left dirty little eBay behind.

Topic.Title: eBay is a Sinking Ship

Message.Msg: "eBay is a Sinking Ship." Wrong again Gilligan. This stock is sitting pretty in the mid 50's. It was $40 back in November 2011. Doesn't sound like a sinking ship to me. Sully

Topic.Title: Tax cheats will suffer greatly

Message.Msg: First off, It's Arthur Andersen and during my tenure as an underwriter in the 1990's, did a brief stint at Accenture, only a small percentage of the company was corrupt. Take eBay today... they are doing the same things that brought Andersen and Enron down. Creative books, smoke and mirrors and a whole lot of pumping and dumping by executives. It's only a matter of time before eBay goes down and CEO John Donahoe ends up in federal prison. $28 million in compensation in 2012 is a red flag this guy is up to no good but, those who fail to study the past are doomed to repeat it.

Topic.Title: Tax cheats will suffer greatly

Message.Msg: At some point, some starry-eyed federal prosecutor who isn't on the payroll is going to look at Ebay's books and bring charges. CEO John Donahoe will end up in prison, mark my words.

Topic.Title: N ew ebay fees ridiculous

CEO and executive management want to be compensated more than 10x the President of the US. Only a matter of time until the SEC and FTC step in to clamp down on eBay and Paypal.

Topic.Title: Ebay Customer Service

Message.Msg: eBay = Worst Customer Service ever.... Called Netflix today to cancel my account. Took 2 minutes with an English speaking US rep. Probably didn't mean the insults but then again, I'm not used to dealing with haggard Filipinos making $1 per hour. He told me he was getting paid $1 per hour to work for eBay.
